SchoolPlanner4Untis
 Version Beta 3 Update 3
 
 Mathias Kub
 Sebastian Chlan
 Christian Pascher
 
 team@schoolplanner.at
 www.schoolplanner.at
 
 Used libraries

Color-Picker-Dialog android-color-picker
 code.google.com/p/android-color-picker/

Help

Display dependent menu entries

Depending on the actual display, you can see different menu entries to organize the time table quickly. The help screen can be access from every display.

Display dependent help

Every display has its own help text. If there is none available, this one is shown.

Further help

If you required further help or got questions about our app, you can contact us by sending an e-mail to team@schoolplanner.at or visiting our website http://www.schoolplanner.at/.

Help

Login data

Server URL: The URL of the server, like \'urania.webtermin.com\', without protocol (\'http://\') and the path of WebUntis (\'/WebUntis/\').
School name: Name of the school that you use to authenticate at WebUntis.
Username: Username you use to log in at WebUntis.
Password: Password you use to log in at WebUntis.

Automatic Login

You can activate the option Auto-Login to automatically log in when you start the app.
If you do so, this dialog will be skipped.

Login-sets

If you created login sets, you can select them here.
Thereby, the actual login data is replaced by the data the login-set uses.

Manage your login-sets

You can manage your login-sets in the menu settings after you logged into the app.

Help for this screen follows.

Help

Display dependent menu entries

Depending on the actual display, you can see different menu entries to organize the time table quickly. The help screen can be access from every display.

Further help

If you required further help or got questions about our app, you can contact us by sending an e-mail to team@schoolplanner.at or visiting our website http://www.schoolplanner.at/.

Help

On this screen you can see the timetable of the currently selected week. Some information may not be shown completely, because of the limited space.

Finger-gestures

Switch the week

To get to the previous or next week, you can use finger-gestures easilly.

Display a day

To display one day and watch it in detail, you have to touch the name in the header.
To be able to do that, you have to activate the option \'Show names of days in weekview\' in the settings.

Show detailed lesson information

To display detailed lesson information, you have to touch the choosen lesson.

Add exams

You can add exams by touching and holding down your finger on a lesson. After that, you can choose \'New\' form the appearing context menu.

Green dot

The green dot marks a lesson that contains more information than you can see.

Exceptional lessons

None-standard lessons (e.g. substitution, cancel, exam) are highlighted.

Background colors of highlighted lessons

Cancelled: red
Substitution: orange
Exams: green
Break supervision: violet

Help for this screen follows.

Help

Data

On this screen you can find detailed information about the currently selected lesson.
Information for Classes, Teachers, Subjects and Rooms can be viewed here, furthermore the lesson type (e.g. substitution) plus the less conde (e.g. break supervision) are shown.
A teacher listed in (brackets) symbolizes that this teacher is missing, another one might be added instead. This applies for switched rooms as well.

New test

If you press the button \'New test\', you can add exams to the currently selected lesson.
